dialogues.text: Growing up, my family observed all the Thanksgiving traditions. My favorite was my Uncle Moshit telling the Thanksgiving Story.

dialogues.text: The cramped space is filled with hungry vets, hookers, trannies, etc...some still shivering from the cold. Jackie, wearing a black hair net underneath a sanitary hat, is dishing out food. While dishing out food, he speaks into a microphone on a stand;

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Uncle Moshit told me that before the first Thanksgiving, Pilgrims thought turkeys were sex objects. They couldn’t fly and “gobble gobble” was Puritan for “blowjob”. When the Indians showed up - right after the Macy’s Parade - they brought turkeys all trussed up. The Pilgrims were pissed. They were like “They’re eating our fuck birds”. But being Puritans, they didn’t want to be rude. And it turned out, turkeys tasted better than going down on their wives. Beyond the line of homeless, Jackie can’t help notice - HARMONY, refilling ice tea and cups of coffee - laughs at Jackie’s routine along with the crowd.

dialogues.text: (interrupting) Watch it, Meriam. I may cancel our date. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Harmony) * You got a moment? * Harmony excuses herself and talks with Jackie to the edge of the patio. JACKIE (CONT’D) * Maybe we can get a cup of coffee -- *

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: (overlaps) * Look, Jackie, it’s nice to see you * but I don’t know what you’re doing * here. What happened with us - it’s * not going to ever happen again. * Ever. *

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Hey, all I did was invite you to * dinner... *

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: I know, but--

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: It’s just a dinner.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, I

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: And maybe a hand job.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: I’m kidding! Jesus! What’s going * on with you? *

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: I just wanted to stop to say hello. Is that so wrong? Harmony calms down a bit. Jackie’s being genuine. *

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: No. It’s just ... I haven’t been feeling that great. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Nothing, just tired. Look, don’t feel obligated to do this thing for Mac. I can tell him you’ve got work going on in NY.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Eh, it might be fun. Tell you the truth, I could use a break. This May Connor thing was a bust. I’m like the John Wilkes Booth of comedy.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: OK. Maybe we can have dinner tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: You sure? ‘Cause I don’t want to give you any impression that I’m available. Me, Adele and Miriam are gonna have a three-way. But you can always join us.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: (WALKS AWAY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shut-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANNER; TELEVISION CLASSICS.COM. Convention attendees arrive in all many of dress, looking like their favorite TV characters from the past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The convention hall is filled with fans dressed as their favorite characters. There are stands with logos from past television shows where actors who are no longer working sign autographs and merch. from their shows. Jackie, dressed as “EDDIE”, sits with a MIDDLE AGED FAN also dressed as “EDDIE”.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: It’s like looking in a mirror. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FAN
dialogues.text: Are you still friends with the other actors? Arlene and your son?

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Uh, no, we haven’t kept in touch. Let me ask you something, doesn’t it get old? I mean, how can it be funny if you know all the jokes? Does it still make you laugh?

dialogues.speaker: FAN
dialogues.text: Sometimes. Not like it did but-- It’s like when you’re little and you want someone to read you the same story every night the same way. It’s like...I don’t know ...comforting. Jackie doesn’t know how to respond. The Fan is clearly a lonely guy. Guileless and genuine.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Well thanks very much for coming.

dialogues.speaker: FAN
dialogues.text: Thanks for being “Eddie”. Jackie nods. The Fan rises and exits. Jackie can’t wait for this to be over. EXT. HARMONY’S CONDO/PATIO ENTRANCE - NIGHT 6 Jackie is dressed for dinner. He appears on the patio * entrance and knocks on the glass patio doors. * The doors slide open to reveal Harmony - dressed in * sweats and a T-Shirt. She looks worn out. *

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: (enters) *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Ready?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Oh, no. I’m sorry, Jackie. I * should have called you. I’m really * tired. I think I’m just gonna stay * in tonight. *

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: (suspicious) *

dialogues.speaker: OK.
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: You look nice.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Thanks. Awkward beat. Harmony doesn’t invite him in. JACKIE (CONT’D) Are you sure everything’s all right?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Why?

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. We had a nice time and now, something feels off. Are you seeing somebody?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Did I do something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: No...Not really.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Not really? What? Harmony takes a beat, looks at Jackie, sighs and turns. She crosses him to sit on her patio chair.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Oh man. This would have been so much easier if you didn’t show up.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: (Beat) I’m pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: (surprised) What! - He stops. Harmony is staring at him. Jackie starts to calculate. His mind races. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Your sure?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Yeah. The timing’s right. I haven’t been with anybody since. Jackie is momentarily speechless. HARMONY (CONT’ D) Listen, I wasn’t going to tell you...

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: You're sure it’s mine?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Yes, I am. Believe me, I’m as surprised as you are.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: No, I don’t think you are.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: I wasn’t going to at first. I had the appointment at the clinic all set. Drove myself down there. But I couldn’t get out of the car...I kept thinking about that night with you...and talking about my Mom...and, all of a sudden, I just couldn’t do it. I couldn’t let this baby feel unwanted the way I did. And, for like the first time, I felt really clear about something, ya know? Weird, huh? And it’s probably my last chance so... I’m scared, but I want to give it a shot.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: And what about me? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: What about you?

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Don’t I have any say in this?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: What do you want to say?

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Maybe I don’t want to be a father again.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Nobody’s asking you to be.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: You're having my kid, that makes me a father ... an older father of a little Baby ... The well-being of this kid, I cannot guarantee, cause I may not be here.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Yes, that’s true, but what I’m doing isn’t a whim - It’s me coming to a decision about my life.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: You're having my kid without my permission and I’m not supposed to get upset?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Your permission? This isn’t about you! HIS CELL RINGS. The phone screen reads: MILLER. Jackie presses IGNORE.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: You can’t just decide this on your own like it doesn’t affect me.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: I didn’t ask you come to here. And I didn’t have to tell you. But I liked you. So, ya know what, just forget it. This baby is my choice, for my life. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you don’t want to have anything to do with it, then don’t. JACKIE’S CELL RINGS AGAIN. AGAIN IT’S MILLER. HARMONY (CONT’ D) You should take that. Harmony closes the sliding doors, locking it. Jackie’s left locked outside. He takes a beat. 106. Then walks out toward the Intercoastal and answers his cell.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: MILLER, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: You're viral again. (looking at her computer) ) You're singing some “Poopie” song to a bunch of senior citizens. INT. MILLER’S OFFICE - DAY Miller sits at a table in front of her laptop, with a coffee, watching a YOU TUBE VIDEO of his singing “Making Poopy” with the residents. It’s been overdubbed with A HIP HOP BEAT.

dialogues.speaker: MILLER
dialogues.text: Over three million views in eight hours and it keeps climbing. You're on Kimmel. You’ re on Conan. Carol from RAW TV called me. She needs a host for a reality show pilot. They shoot on Monday in NY?

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Monday? Why so fast?

dialogues.speaker: MILLER
dialogues.text: They had D’Angelo signed but he had to drop out last minute.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Why? He got a better deal?

dialogues.speaker: MILLER
dialogues.text: He’s got pancreatic cancer. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Finally, I catch a fuckin’ break * in this business. INT. FRIAR’S CLUB - DAY 68 Miller sits at a table in front of her laptop, with a coffee, watching a YOU TUBE VIDEO of his singing “Making Poopy” with the residents. It’s been overdubbed with A HIP HOP BEAT.

dialogues.speaker: MILLER
dialogues.text: Over three million views in eight * hours and it keeps climbing. You’re on Kimmel. You’ re on Conan. Carol from RAW TV called me. She needs a host for a reality show pilot. They shoot on Monday in NY?

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Monday? Why so fast?

dialogues.speaker: MILLER
dialogues.text: They had D’Angelo signed but he had to drop out last minute.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Why? He got a better deal?

dialogues.speaker: MILLER
dialogues.text: He’s got pancreatic cancer.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Finally, I catch a fuckin’ break in this business. EXT. GOLDEN VISTA VILLAGE - POOL/GOLF COURSE - DAY 6m Mac sits on the deck of his Yacht talking with Larry, * when he sees Jackie walking with his bags to the Condo * Office. *

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: (calls out) * What have we here? The Comedian *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slithering out. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Sorry. I left you a message. I got a gig in NY.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Welching on our deal - I’m not surprised - Fool me once, It’s on you ... Fool me twice, I’m the schmuck.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: This is an important gig ... a TV pilot.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Let me tell you something, Back in the day, when I was makin’ book, I knew who was gonna lose and who was gonna win. I had an instinct. The losers - I’d deposit their money before the race ran. Now get the fuck outta here. Mac’s implication that Jackie is a loser pisses Jackie off. Jackie stops.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: I hear you’re gonna be a grandpa.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: (annoye ) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Well, congratulations. Only, don’t be surprised if your grand kid’s doing one liners, holding his dick like a microphone. See ya at the bris. Mac stands-up from his deck chair, momentarily stunned. Jackie walks back toward the office. JACKIE (CONT’D)

dialogues.speaker: ARRLEEEEENE
dialogues.text: Mac doesn’t know how to respond. INT. HARMONY’S CONDO - PATIO - DAY Harmony is sitting in a chair reading a Magazine. Mac, red-faced, charges in. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 69 + FH HH OF ee *

dialogues.speaker: OF
dialogues.text: +e FH OF 70

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: You’ re having Eddie’s baby!?! Harmony, completely unruffled gazes up at Mac who notices the change.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: No, I’m having my baby.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: You told me it was a sperm donor!

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Well, in a way, it was.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: That’s not funny! Jackie Eddie Burke! What did I do? Wasn’t I always there for you? Didn’t I do everything for you?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: You did the best you could in your way. And I appreciate it. Now it’s my turn.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: What does that mean!?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: You know what it means. Making my own decisions and living with them, without you.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Without me? You’re going over a cliff again sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Do you hear yourself? It’s like you want me to fail. Why?

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: How can you say that? I’ve always been there for you. I had to be a mother and a father. I did the best I could. I don’t deserve this.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Why did my mother leave? (CONTINUED)
Pause. Mac sees in Harmony’s expression that this time she wants Mac sits an answer.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: I don’t know...Maybe I wasn’t the best husband. Maybe I pushed her into things she didn’t really want.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Like being a mother?

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: I don’t know. She left. I stayed.... Don’t go, kid. Harmony senses a vulnerability in him she’s never seen. Mac nods.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: It can’t be the way it’s been, Mac. Not anymore.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: I’m having my baby. And you don’t have a Goddamn thing to say about it. Harmony stands. Mac, quietly;

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: All right. Let it be. Whatever you want... Only don’t leave me. His head bowed, he takes her hand. Harmony feels compassion. She strokes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The television taping is underway. Jackie is addressing a studio audience. He wears an expensive suit. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Hello everybody. I’m Uncle Jackie Burke and welcome to “SAY UNCLE”, the new reality show where we actually torture people until they say, “Uncle”. Our first contestant is Mark Chapel from Brookline, Massachusetts. How you doing today, Mark?

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: Great. Reveal MARK - a middle aged dad wearing only goggles and a bathing suit. TWO SEXY, SCANTILY-CLAD MODELS are painting his body with molasses. His wife and kids watch from the front row. Miller stands with Carol and two of her RIOT TV execs behind the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Right now our two anthropology majors from Camel Toe U are basting you with molasses. When they’ re done, all you have to do is lay down in this geese pen and we’ll release these hungry birds. Reveal a GEESE PEN full of squawking geese. Mark lays down. A small picket fence separates him from the birds.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Don’t forget Mark. If you last two minutes with the geese, you’1l1 win this new hybrid car and a Carribbean vacation for you and your entire family. Mark’s family jumps up and down. Jackie takes notice. One kid - around three - has no idea what’s happening.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: You’ re sure you’re ready?

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: Yes, Uncle Jackie.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Are you wearing a protective cup? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Okay then Mark, you better hold on tight to those butter balls as I release the angry birds. Jackie pulls a lever and a wall in the pen lifts up. The audience cheers as the geese begin pecking at Mark’s skin. At first it tickles. The audience is laughing.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Hang in there Mark! You’re halfway home. Mark begins rolling around frantically as the birds become more aggressive. The contestant is clearly bleeding from numerous cuts. He squeals in pain. In the front row, his children are scared. Jackie sees Mark’s three old starts to cry. Jackie see

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: Ahhh! Ahhh!

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: You can do it, Mark. This time next week, you’ll be in the Bahamas with your beautiful family. His family winces, upset and scared. Jackie fights off the disgust he feels. He looks over to Miller. Everyone around her is cheering, but she knows Jackie so well.

dialogues.speaker: AHHH
dialogues.text: The cheering suddenly stops as Mark leaps out of the pen. He is covered in hay, brown sugar and splotches of blood. His family is horrified. Jackie puts his arms around Mark, along with a towel and robe, and looks into camera.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: “Say Uncle” will be right back. But as for me, I’d rather have Stevie Wonder shave my testicles with a butcher knife than be part of a this reality shit. So this is Jackie Burke saying “Uncle”, and Riot TV can go fuck itself!!!! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jackie steps off the set. The crew and audience stare in disbelief. As he crosses Carol, Jackie says:

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: And I’m keeping the suit. Miller looks to Carol, then exits after Jackie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie walks out onto the sidewalk. He’s not bummed - in fact, he’s exhilarated. He smiles as he walks away. CLOSE UP: Jackie’s shoes - There’s a spring in his step.

dialogues.speaker: MATCH CUT TO
dialogues.text: CLOSE-UP: JACKIE’S LEATHER TENNIS SHOES WITH THE SAME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie walks through the rush of Village hipsters. He turns and descends down the familiar stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie enters. He feels at home here. A safe haven. Miller sits at the ‘comics table’ kibitzing with several clients before they go on.. ESTEE, The COMEDY CELLAR Booker leans over.

dialogues.speaker: ESTEE
dialogues.text: Jackie, sit. You going on tonight? Jackie senses a change. They’re all smiling.

dialogues.speaker: ESTEE
dialogues.text: Any spot you want. Let me know.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: What gives?

dialogues.speaker: COMEDIAN
dialogues.text: That video went viral like crazy.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: What video? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Miller takes out her phone, hits Safari and plays: * JACKIE’S FULL WALK-OUT FROM THE REALITY SHOW.

dialogues.speaker: MILLER
dialogues.text: Six million views and counting. *

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: How’d you get the tape? Miller, just bobs her eyebrows. He kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOST takes the mic;

dialogues.speaker: HOST
dialogues.text: We have a surprise guest with us tonight. The man of the hour who told Raw TV to go fuck itself. Let’s give it up for Jackie Burke. The crowd goes wild. Applause. Some stand. Some hold out their phones with the video playing. Cheers. But no one is more surprised that Jackie. He takes the mic;

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: I’m a hit. Who the fuck knew?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. POOL/GOLDEN VISTA VILLAGE - DAY 1s Harmony sits with Meriam talking about the community. * Harmony - a few months pregnant now, starting to show *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie appears carrying a box towards Harmony. When Harmony sees Jackie she is surprised. Jackie is equally * surprised by Harmony’s condition. *

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Wow. You look you. How are ya?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: I’m fine.... Harmony is about to ask “what are you doing here?”... *

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Look, I...I don’t want to cause a * thing. I... * (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I wanted to call and find out how you were but it felt strange to just call after the way we left things...and I wanted to give you something anyway so I flew in. You look great.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Thanks. What’s that? Jackie takes out some photos from the box.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: I leave this to your decision. But I thought - whether I’m in the kid’s life or not, Jackie hands her the box ... an old wooden wine box. JACKIE (CONT’D) Just photos of me and my family he or she may want to know some things about me.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Wow ... Thanks. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: I just want to say, I’d like to be a part of the kid’s life in any way you're comfortable with. You make the rules. Whatever you decide. Think about it. Don’t say anything now, OK?

dialogues.speaker: OK.
dialogues.text: Jackie and Harmony have a silent beat.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Take care of yourself.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: You too. Without another word Jackie walks away. Harmony watches him leave. Then she looks down into the box: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: We see a whole treasure trove of photos of Jackie’s family life ... not his career ... his family. Jackie as a young boy, Jimmy and Britany when she was a little girl, etc. The only momento of his career is one of his albums: “Inside Jackie Burke”. Harmony looks after Jackie who has disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A parking lot of cars. A CAB OR TOWN CAR drives up to the entrance and stops (carrying Jackie from the airport - we may or may not see him exit)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BANNER READS: TALENT SHOW. The audiences is filled with parents with video cameras or phones, recording their kids. A LITTLE GIRL is on stage singing, off key. Harmony is sitting with the new man in her life. We’1ll call him GARY - age appropriate. Working class style. Nice, down to earth guy. They holds hands. AN EMPTY SEAT waits beside Harmony. From the back of the auditorium, Jackie enters with a carry-on bag. He spots Harmony and sits in the empty seat. They whisper as the kid on stage sings: (NOTE: THE GENDER OF JACKIE AND HARMONY’S KID WILL BE

dialogues.speaker: SUBJECT TO CASTING. FOR THE SCRIPT, IT WILL READ HE/SHE
dialogues.text: or HER/HIM).

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Oh good you made it.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: My flight got delayed. Hi Gary.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Hey Jackie.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Did I miss her/him?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: She/he’s next. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The kid on stage finishes on a sour note but everyone applauds and cheers. Over the Loud Speaker, we hear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie, Harmony and Gary applaud with the audience. Jackie and Harmony’s 8 year old crosses to center stage, stands before a microphone to do a stand-up routine. JACKIE/HARMONY’S KID So what’s the deal with chores and allowances? I turn eight and my mom says “I’1ll give you ten dollars a week to make your room, wash the dishes and clean the cat’s litter box”. Ten dollars? That’s slave labor. I go to our neighbor’s house and I say, “What’11 you give me if I make your room, wash your dishes and clean your cat’s litter box?” Neighbor says I don’t have a cat. So I piss in her hallway and say, “You go to 15 a week and I’1l supply the pussy”. Various shots of stunned parents, appalled and shocked. ON JACKIE and HARMONY - laughs, beaming with pride. BACK ON THE KID. Not getting a response, he/she taps the microphone. JACKIE/HARMONY’S KID This fucking thing on? Jackie and Harmony smile proudly.
